Here is the solved puzzle:


|               |     1     |      2      |     3      |      4      |
| Hobby         | skydiving |  video-games |   baking    | woodworking |
| Job           | musician  | architect    | analyst     | bartender   |
| Movie-Genre   | action    | epic         | drama       | thriller    |
| Nationality   | german    | british      | american    | canadian    |
| Transport     | helicopter| motorbike    | car         | bike        |

Here's how the solution was arrived at:

From clue 10, we know that the person who's hobby is skydiving is on the far left.

From clue 2, the musician is on the left of the Canadian. Since the Canadian can't be in position 1 (because of the musician), and the musician can't be in position 4 (because the thriller movie fan is there), the musician must be in position 2 or 3. But from clue 9, we know that the musician is to the right of the person watching action movies, so the musician must be in position 2.

From clue 1, the thriller movie fan is on the far right (position 4). From clue 6, the British is the architect. Since the helicopter driver is to the right of the British (clue 3), and there's no space for the British to the left of the musician, the British must be in position 2.

From clue 7, the person who's hobby is video-games is between the person who's hobby is skydiving and the German. The only possible positions are that the video-game player is in position 1 (between the skydiver and no one), which can't happen since there must be a gap; or that they're in position 2, with the skydiver on their left and the German on their right.

From clue 5, the analyst is in an odd-numbered position. The only available spaces are positions 1 and 3. Since the person driving the car (the American) must be in position 3 (clue 4), and we already have a hobby assigned to position 1 (skydiving), the analyst must go in position 3.

From clue 12, the person watching epic movies is the American. But since the American is in position 3, the epic movie fan must be there too.

From clue 8, the motorbike driver is on either side of the epic movie fan (who's in position 3). Since the British is already in position 2 and can't drive a car, bike or helicopter (because they're the architect), they must drive the motorbike. The only space left for the motorbike driver is position 2.

From clue 11, the person who's hobby is baking is on either side of the action movie fan. Since position 1 has skydiving and we can't put baking there (because it would be even), baking must go in position 3 or be the epic movie fan (but that spot is already taken by the American). Thus, baking goes in position 3.

From clue 14, the person who's hobby is baking is in an odd-numbered position. Since they're already in position 3, we don't need to move them.

The only remaining positions are for woodworking and drama movies, which must go together (since epic is taken by the American) and must be in position 4 (since thriller has that spot), with the Canadian.

Thus, we have:


|               |     1     |      2      |     3      |      4      |
| Hobby         | skydiving |  video-games |   baking    | woodworking |
| Job           | musician  | architect    | analyst     | bartender   |
| Movie-Genre   | action    | epic         | drama       | thriller    |
| Nationality   | german    | british      | american    | canadian    |
| Transport     | helicopter| motorbike    | car         | bike        |

I hope this explanation was clear! Let me know if you have any further questions.
